ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson nods in understanding.  He wasn t going blind after all but the lack of light did not bother him in the least.  He settles down with Big Convoy, coiling

Tucson nods in understanding.  He wasn't going blind after all but the lack=
 of light did not bother him in the least.  He settles down with Big Convoy=
, coiling his long tail as a courtesy to his new comrade, hoping not to imp=
ose on him at all.  As he lays down, he tucks all four limbs under his body=
 and gives a bit of a yawn.  His teeth and saber like fangs glisten in what=
 little light there could be  in the chamber.  After a long stretch of his =
jaws, Tucson closes his mouth and turns to Big Convoy.

" So much corruptio=
n, greed and deception.  How much of that can any planet endure before it c=
omes to it's death? Magmatron is to me a murderer from what you told me.  I=
 do hope our alliance can finally put an end to his unjust wrath.  And one =
thing is certain, and I hate to admit it, but after seeing what has been do=
ne to Rodimus and his own lack of determination to fend off his own demons,=
 there isn't anything I can do to help him.  I tried and I almost succeeded=
 but a lot of that depends on Rodimus.  If he wants to fight it he has to d=
o that on his own.  But I know now that he chose his path, and I can not ge=
t him out of his own mess.  And a bit of a mess it is.  He wants to work as=
 an enemy, then so be it.  He will be treated as one.  Big Convoy, you will=
 see a part of me that may appear rather ruthless, but it is only to convey=
 an important message.  Those who oppose me pay a painful price, and Rodimu=
s has now opposed me more than a few times.  He will not be spared of his c=
onsequences when we encounter each other.  To me he is THE ENEMY."

His opt=
ics glow an icy blue as draconic eyes narrow in thought.

Perpetually on th=
e move and constantly busy. 

On Oct 12, 2011, at 12:25 PM, Super Cyclonus =
<supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson salutes Longrack=
, Stampy and Sharpedge.
> >
> > " Honored to have you working with me. I ho=
pe we can merge our forces even
> > further. It's exactly what our faction =
needs, unity. With that we can
> > combat those who threaten to oppose and =
oppress the innocent. "
> >
> > He then turns back to Big Convoy.
> >
> > "=
 Anything you can tell me about Magmatron will gladly be appreciated.
> > H=
mm.."
> >
> > He had not told Big Convoy that he had spent most of his time=
 living as a
> > visually impaired Autobot. But a bit of visual impairment =
did not scare him,
> > he was used to it. It's not long before the room goe=
s black on him once
> > again. But instead of panic, he straightens up, and=
 cocks his ears to the
> > direction of the cell entrance. Footsteps. They =
were very far off but he
> > could hear them with surprising clarity, and f=
or once was happy to have his
> > sense of hearing returned. Along with tha=
t his sense of touch and taste
> > were also enhanced as he uses his nostri=
ls to feel the rise of temperatures
> > in the room,
> >
> > " Ah, that was=
 part of my problem. I am not used to working with vision,
> > I've lived w=
ith blindness most of my life and have learned to adapt. That
> > is who I =
am and trying to change that has left a bit of a void. But now I
> > unders=
tand, through darkness there is light, even though my eyes were never
> > m=
eant to see it. I can do this, I can fight Rodimus and no matter how well
>=
 > he was trained, one can never see the way a sightless warrior can. He ma=
y
> > be trained but he has never lost his sight. I have and I have learned=
 to
> > compensate for it"
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> There was a nod from BIG CONVOY =
as the lights in his room flicker once
> and then dim down to near darkness=
. "It is the night cycle." He siad
> dryly, his optics glowing in the new d=
arkness of the room. "For most
> it is the time to recharge the power cells=
."
> 
> CONVOY gestured to the dual rehcaing chambers. "You can stay in thi=
s
> cell with me." He said. "The others already have their bunk mates."
> 
=
> Turning back to TUSCON, "As for Magmatron." There was a small shrug.
> "H=
e is a Predacon warlord, some even say that he was part of the
> Decepticon=
 wars that came before. Extemely dangerous and never to be
> underestimated=
."
> 
> "I was sent to planet Gaea to capture him, he and his chief scienti=
st
> Saberback have been interested in Unicron for centuries. BIG CONVOY
> =
grunted, "He has been stealing his energon and using whatever
> equipment w=
as left behind after his attacks on various worlds."
> 
> CONVOY loked at T=
USCON, "He had ammassed quite a bit on Gaea, and my
> team and I were only =
just able to defeat him." He grunted again, "And
> we were captured ourselv=
es, and we were working to free ourselves when
> you showed up."
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Tucson nods in understanding.  He=
 wasn't going blind after all but the lack of light did not bother him in t=
he least.  He settles down with Big Convoy, coiling his long tail as a=
 courtesy to his new comrade, hoping not to impose on him at all.  As =
he lays down, he tucks all four limbs under his body and gives a bit of a y=
awn.  His teeth and saber like fangs glisten in what little light ther=
e could be  in the chamber.  After a long stretch of his jaws, Tu=
cson closes his mouth and turns to Big Convoy.</div><div><br></div><div>" S=
o much corruption, greed and deception.  How much of that can any plan=
et endure before it comes to it's death? Magmatron is to me a murderer from=
 what you told me.  I do hope our alliance can finally put an end to h=
is unjust wrath.  And one thing is certain, and I hate to admit it, bu=
t after seeing what has been done to Rodimus and his own lack of determinat=
ion to fend off his own demons, there isn't anything I can do to help him. =
 I tried and I almost succeeded but a lot of that depends on Rodimus. =
 If he wants to fight it he has to do that on his own.  But I kno=
w now that he chose his path, and I can not get him out of his own mess. &n=
bsp;And a bit of a mess it is.  He wants to work as an enemy, then so =
be it.  He will be treated as one.  Big Convoy, you will see a pa=
rt of me that may appear rather ruthless, but it is only to convey an impor=
tant message.  Those who oppose me pay a painful price, and Rodimus ha=
s now opposed me more than a few times.  He will not be spared of his =
consequences when we encounter each other.  To me he is THE ENEMY."</d=
iv><div><br></div><div>His optics glow an icy blue as draconic eyes narrow =
in thought.</div><div><br>Perpetually on the move and constantly busy.&nbsp=

<p>> <OLD><br>
><br>
> Tucson salutes Longrack, Stampy and S=
harpedge.<br>
><br>
> " Honored to have you working with me.  I hope =
we can merge our forces even<br>
> further.  It's exactly what our facti=
on needs, unity.  With that we can<br>
> combat those who threaten to op=
pose and oppress the innocent. "<br>
><br>
> He then turns back to Bi=
g Convoy.<br>
><br>
> " Anything you can tell me about Magmatron will=
 gladly be appreciated.<br>
> Hmm.."<br>
><br>
> He had not told B=
ig Convoy that he had spent most of his time living as a<br>
> visually =
impaired Autobot. But a bit of visual impairment did not scare him,<br>
&gt=
; he was used to it.  It's not long before the room goes black on him once<=
br>
> again.  But instead of panic, he straightens up, and cocks his ear=
s to the<br>
> direction of the cell entrance.  Footsteps.  They were ve=
ry far off but he<br>
> could hear them with surprising clarity, and for=
 once was happy to have his<br>
> sense of hearing returned.  Along with=
 that his sense of touch and taste<br>
> were also enhanced as he uses h=
is nostrils to feel the rise of temperatures<br>
> in the room,<br>
>=
<br>
> " Ah, that was part of my problem.  I am not used to working with=
 vision,<br>
> I've lived with blindness most of my life and have learne=
d to adapt.  That<br>
> is who I am and trying to change that has left a=
 bit of a void.  But now I<br>
> understand, through darkness there is l=
ight, even though my eyes were never<br>
> meant to see it.  I can do th=
is, I can fight Rodimus and no matter how well<br>
> he was trained, one=
 can never see the way a sightless warrior can.  He may<br>
> be trained=
 but he has never lost his sight.  I have and I have learned to<br>
> co=
mpensate for it"<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
There was a nod from BIG CON=
VOY as the lights in his room flicker once<br>
and then dim down to near da=
rkness. "It is the night cycle." He siad<br>
dryly, his optics glowing in t=
he new darkness of the room. "For most<br>
it is the time to recharge the p=
ower cells."<br>
<br>
CONVOY gestured to the dual rehcaing chambers. "You c=
an stay in this<br>
cell with me." He said. "The others already have their =
bunk mates."<br>
<br>
Turning back to TUSCON, "As for Magmatron." There was=
 a small shrug.<br>
"He is a Predacon warlord, some even say that he was pa=
rt of the<br>
Decepticon wars that came before. Extemely dangerous and neve=
r to be<br>
underestimated."<br>
<br>
"I was sent to planet Gaea to capture=
 him, he and his chief scientist<br>
Saberback have been interested in Unic=
ron for centuries. BIG CONVOY<br>
grunted, "He has been  stealing his energ=
on and using whatever<br>
equipment was left behind after his attacks on va=
rious worlds."<br>
<br>
CONVOY loked at TUSCON, "He had ammassed quite a bi=
t on Gaea, and my<br>
team and I were only just able to defeat him." He gru=
nted again, "And<br>
we were captured ourselves, and we were working to fre=
e ourselves when<br>
you showed up."<br>
